Script: If you like heartwarming Japanese food, this Japanese restaurant is perfect for you. Hey yâ€™all, itâ€™s Yena, and come with me to Kimura in East Village, NYC. Kimura is well-known for their motsunabe (Japanese hotpot), and you can mix and match. We got Collagen Nabe and Sukiyaki for three people. For the Sukiyaki, donâ€™t forget to dip the meats in egg! Kimura is pretty busy, but itâ€™s well-worth the wait for a cozy meal. Follow me for more places to inhale food & drinksies!
Caption - insta:
When I want to feel cozy and at peace, Japanese restaurant @kimura_nyc is a go-to ğŸ«¶
1ï¸âƒ£Â I love how Kimura has a variety of food options - while there are skewers and grilled meats, you order the motsunabe (hot pot) dishes as servings per person, giving you more flexibility in dining choices.
2ï¸âƒ£Â FYI their bathroom is in the back of the restaurant, down a set of stairs. It can take a hot sec to find, but the staff is super helpful!
3ï¸âƒ£Â Hot pot servings are around $30 per person, and apps are around $15.

Hereâ€™s what we got!
ğŸ˜Â Kushi Age Mini Combo Skewers (3 skewer choice - Scallop, Sweet Potato, Beef)
ğŸ˜Â Collagen Nabe (1 serving, Classic Flavor) â£ï¸Pork pieces were nice n soft - very cozy
ğŸ˜Â Sukiyaki (2 servings) â£ï¸Â a little on the sweeter side! You dip the meat in the egg!
